definition: lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
leaf/page/lobe/(historical) period/classifier for small boats
surname Ye
to be in harmony
to block/to hinder/to obstruct
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title

sentences.english: When a relationship is real, it's growing;
sentences.chinese: 很多时候，我们没有头绪，被一叶障目。

sentences.english: But there are those who prefer the darkness. Because there, they see only what they choose to see.
sentences.chinese: 可有些人选择黑暗，因为漆黑中，他们得以一叶障目。

sentences.english: But there is a danger of missing the wood for the trees.
sentences.chinese: 但这些改革有着一叶障目，不见泰山的风险。

definition: unable to see the wood for the trees/fig. only able to see isolated details, and not the bigger picture
pinyin: zhi3 jian4 shu4 mu4 bu4 jian4 sen1 lin2

definition: lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
short-sighted

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
to be shortsighted
see 求全責備|求全责备[qiu2 quan2 ze2 bei4]
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
(lit.) to take a part for the whole/to generalize
lit. not to know the true face of Lushan Mountain/fig. can't see the forest for the trees
pinyin: bu4 shi4 Lu2 shan1 zhen1 mian4 mu4

definition: lit. the eye cannot see the eyelashes (idiom); fig. unable to see one's own faults/to lack self-awareness/truths too close to home
to demand perfection (idiom)
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
the frog at the bottom of the well (idiom)/fig. a person of limited outlook and experience
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
